DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text term that represents the line notation for entering and representing molecules of the compound chemical structure without the use of a special data type or drawing.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Simplified Molecular Input Line Entry Specification Description
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Specification for unambiguously describing the structure of chemical molecules using short ASCII strings.  SMILES strings can be imported by most molecular editors for conversion back into two-dimensional drawings or three-dimensional models for the molecules._A written or verbal account, representation, statement, or explanation of something.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Simplified Molecular Input Line Entry Specification
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Specification for unambiguously describing the structure of chemical molecules using short ASCII strings.  SMILES strings can be imported by most molecular editors for conversion back into two-dimensional drawings or three-dimensional models for the molecules.

Concepts.longName: Simplified Molecular Input Line Entry Specification
Concepts.definition: Specification for unambiguously describing the structure of chemical molecules using short ASCII strings.  SMILES strings can be imported by most molecular editors for conversion back into two-dimensional drawings or three-dimensional models for the molecules.

Property.preferredDefinition: A statement or an account describing something.

Concepts.definition: A written or verbal account, representation, statement, or explanation of something.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: A category of organic or inorganic substances, elements, and isotopes used in research or for the prevention, diagnosis, and/or treatment of disease states. Includes biologically active substances that are either synthetically manufactured or endogenous substances extracted and processed to be reintroduced into an organism. Chemicals and drugs also include hazardous substances, and naturally occurring or synthetically produced substances required to maintain life.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Curated to support CTD2 activity per request by S.Jagu. mc 10/28/15

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: A category of organic or inorganic substances, elements, and isotopes used in research or for the prevention, diagnosis, and/or treatment of disease states. Includes biologically active substances that are either synthetically manufactured or endogenous substances extracted and processed to be reintroduced into an organism. Chemicals and drugs also include hazardous substances, and naturally occurring or synthetically produced substances required to maintain life.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Text; the words of something written.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created for CTD^2 project per request by S.Jagu. Max length intentionally left blank. mc 10/29/15
